151  def callback(self,data):
152  self.result = [-1, -1, -1]
153  try:
154  self.estimate_volume(data)
155 
156  except CvBridgeError as e:

159  def estimate_volume(self, data):
160  """!
161  @brief we do all process in this function
162  @details
163 
164  @param[in] data: ros image message
165 
166  @note input constraints:
167  @n - none
168 
169  @note output constraints:
170  @n - none
171 
172  @return none
173  """
174  cv_image = self.convert_to_cv_image(data)
175  if(cv_image is None): return
176  else:
177  if(self.debug_flag):
178  self.img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(cv_image, "bgr8"))
179 
180  draft_roi_img = self.get_draft_roi(cv_image)
181  if(draft_roi_img is None): return
182  else:
183  if(self.debug_flag):
184  self.draft_roi_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(draft_roi_img, "bgr8"))
185 
186  big_hsv_img, big_h_img, big_s_img, big_v_img = self.get_hsv(draft_roi_img)
187  if((big_h_img is None) or (big_s_img is None) or (big_v_img is None)): return
188  else:
189  if(self.debug_flag):
190  self.big_hsv_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_hsv_img, "bgr8"))
191  self.big_h_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_h_img, "mono8"))
192  self.big_s_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_s_img, "mono8"))
193  self.big_v_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_v_img, "mono8"))
194 
195  big_ranged_img = self.get_range(big_hsv_img, 0,100,0,40,255,255)
196  if(big_ranged_img is None): return
197  else:
198  if(self.debug_flag):
199  self.big_ranged_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_ranged_img, "mono8"))
200 
201  big_bin_img = self.get_binary(big_h_img, 40)
202  if(big_bin_img is None): return
203  else:
204  if(self.debug_flag):
205  self.big_bin_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_bin_img, "mono8"))
206 
207  big_noise_removed_bin_img, big_mask_bin_img = self.remove_noise(big_ranged_img, 800, 2000, 20, 60, 20, 60, use_morph = False)
208  if(big_noise_removed_bin_img is None): return
209  else:
210  if(self.debug_flag):
211  self.big_noise_removed_bin_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_noise_removed_bin_img, "mono8"))
212  self.big_mask_bin_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(big_mask_bin_img, "mono8"))
213 
214  marker_img, marker_pts = self.detect_marker(big_noise_removed_bin_img)
215  if(marker_img is None): return
216  else:
217  if(self.debug_flag):
218  self.marker_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(marker_img, "bgr8"))
219 
220  trans_img = self.perspective_transform(draft_roi_img, marker_pts)
221  if(trans_img is None): return
222  else:
223  if(self.debug_flag):
224  self.trans_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(trans_img, "bgr8"))
225 
226  each_roi_img_1, each_roi_img_2, each_roi_img_3, each_roi_pts = self.get_each_roi(trans_img)
227  if((each_roi_img_1 is None) or (each_roi_img_2 is None) or (each_roi_img_3 is None)): return
228  else:
229  if(self.debug_flag):
230  self.each_roi_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_roi_img_1, "bgr8"))
231  self.each_roi_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_roi_img_2, "bgr8"))
232  self.each_roi_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_roi_img_3, "bgr8"))
233 
234  each_shadow_removed_img_1 = self.remove_shadow(each_roi_img_1)
235  if(each_shadow_removed_img_1 is None): return
236  else:
237  if(self.debug_flag):
238  self.each_shadow_removed_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_shadow_removed_img_1, "bgr8"))
239 
240  each_shadow_removed_img_2 = self.remove_shadow(each_roi_img_2)
241  if(each_shadow_removed_img_1 is None): return
242  else:
243  if(self.debug_flag):
244  self.each_shadow_removed_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_shadow_removed_img_2, "bgr8"))
245

247  if(each_shadow_removed_img_1 is None): return
248  else:
249  if(self.debug_flag):
250  self.each_shadow_removed_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_shadow_removed_img_3, "bgr8"))
251

253  if(each_bg_removed_img_1 is None): return
254  else:
255  if(self.debug_flag):
256  self.each_bg_removed_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bg_removed_img_1, "bgr8"))
257 
258  each_bg_removed_img_2 = self.remove_background(each_shadow_removed_img_2)
259  if(each_bg_removed_img_2 is None): return
260  else:
261  if(self.debug_flag):
262  self.each_bg_removed_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bg_removed_img_2, "bgr8"))
263 
264  each_bg_removed_img_3 = self.remove_background(each_shadow_removed_img_3)
265  if(each_bg_removed_img_3 is None): return
266  else:
267  if(self.debug_flag):
268  self.each_bg_removed_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bg_removed_img_3, "bgr8"))
269 
270  each_bin_img_1 = self.get_binary(each_bg_removed_img_1, 140)
271  if(each_bin_img_1 is None): return
272  else:
273  if(self.debug_flag):
274  self.each_bin_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bin_img_1, "mono8"))
275 
276  each_bin_img_2 = self.get_binary(each_bg_removed_img_2, 140)
277  if(each_bin_img_2 is None): return
278  else:
279  if(self.debug_flag):
280  self.each_bin_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bin_img_2, "mono8"))
281 
282  each_bin_img_3 = self.get_binary(each_bg_removed_img_3, 140)
283  if(each_bin_img_3 is None): return
284  else:
285  if(self.debug_flag):
286  self.each_bin_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_bin_img_3, "mono8"))
287 
288  each_noise_removed_img_1, each_mask_img_1 = self.remove_noise(each_bin_img_1, 100, 2000, 0, 40, 0, 40, use_morph = False)
289  if(each_noise_removed_img_1 is None): return
290  else:
291  if(self.debug_flag):
292  self.each_noise_removed_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_noise_removed_img_1, "mono8"))
293  self.each_mask_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_mask_img_1, "mono8"))
294 
295  each_noise_removed_img_2, each_mask_img_2 = self.remove_noise(each_bin_img_2, 100, 2000, 0, 40, 0, 40, use_morph = False)
296  if(each_noise_removed_img_2 is None): return
297  else:
298  if(self.debug_flag):
299  self.each_noise_removed_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_noise_removed_img_2, "mono8"))
300  self.each_mask_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_mask_img_2, "mono8"))
301 
302  each_noise_removed_img_3, each_mask_img_3 = self.remove_noise(each_bin_img_3, 100, 2000, 0, 40, 0, 40, use_morph = False)
303  if(each_noise_removed_img_3 is None): return
304  else:
305  if(self.debug_flag):
306  self.each_noise_removed_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_noise_removed_img_3, "mono8"))
307  self.each_mask_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_mask_img_3, "mono8"))
308 
309  bounding_rect_list = []
310 
311  each_small_img_1, bounding_rect_1 = self.get_small_image(each_noise_removed_img_1)
312  if(each_small_img_1 is None):
313  self.rt_vol_msg.data[0] = -1
314  self.str_rt_vol[0] = "X"
315  else:
316  if(self.debug_flag):
317  self.each_small_img_1_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_small_img_1, "mono8"))
318  bounding_rect_list.append(bounding_rect_1)
319 
320  each_small_img_2, bounding_rect_2 = self.get_small_image(each_noise_removed_img_2)
321  if(each_small_img_2 is None):
322  self.rt_vol_msg.data[1] = -1
323  self.str_rt_vol[1] = "X"
324  else:
325  if(self.debug_flag):
326  self.each_small_img_2_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_small_img_2, "mono8"))
327  bounding_rect_list.append(bounding_rect_2)
328 
329  each_small_img_3, bounding_rect_3 = self.get_small_image(each_noise_removed_img_3)
330  if(each_small_img_3 is None):
331  self.rt_vol_msg.data[2] = -1
332  self.str_rt_vol[2] = "X"
333  else:
334  if(self.debug_flag):
335  self.each_small_img_3_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(each_small_img_3, "mono8"))
336  bounding_rect_list.append(bounding_rect_3)
337 
338 
339 
340  # name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/9/' + str(self.num) + '.jpg'
341  # cv2.imwrite(name, each_small_img_3)

343  # self.num = self.num + 1
344  # if(self.num > 1000):
345 
346  # self.num = 1000

348  vol_1 = self.detect_volume(each_small_img_1)
349  if(vol_1 == -1):

351  self.str_rt_vol[0] = "X"
352  else:

355 
356  vol_2 = self.detect_volume(each_small_img_2)
357  if(vol_2 == -1):
358  self.rt_vol_msg.data[1] = -1
359  self.str_rt_vol[1] = "X"
360  else:
361  self.rt_vol_msg.data[1] = vol_2
362  self.str_rt_vol[1] = str(vol_2)
363

365  if(vol_3 == -1):
366  self.rt_vol_msg.data[2] = -1
367  self.str_rt_vol[2] = "X"
368  else:
369  self.rt_vol_msg.data[2] = vol_3
370  self.str_rt_vol[2] = str(vol_3)
371 
372  if(self.debug_flag):
373  self.rt_vol_pub.publish(self.rt_vol_msg)
374 
375  if((vol_1 != -1) and (vol_2 != -1) and (vol_3 != -1)):
376  self.int_rt_vol = vol_1*100 + vol_2*10 + vol_3
377  else:
378  self.int_rt_vol = -1
379 
380  if(self.int_rt_vol != -1):
381  self.valid_vol_msg.data = self.get_valid_volume(self.int_rt_vol, max_param = 1)
382 
383  if(self.debug_flag):
384  self.valid_vol_pub.publish(self.valid_vol_msg)
385 
386  semantic_img, center_diff_percentage = self.get_semantic_image(trans_img, each_roi_pts, bounding_rect_list, self.str_rt_vol, self.valid_vol_msg.data)
387  if (semantic_img is None): return
388  else:
389  if(self.debug_flag):
390  self.semantic_img_pub.publish(self.bridge.cv2_to_imgmsg(semantic_img, "bgr8"))
391  self.center_diff_percentage_msg.data = center_diff_percentage
392  self.center_diff_percentage_pub.publish(self.center_diff_percentage_msg)
393 
394  pass
395 
396  def convert_to_cv_image(self, data):
397  """!
398  @brief when image callback function get the ros image message, convert it to cv_image(for opencv format)
399  @details
400 
401  @param[in] data: ros image message
402 
403  @note input constraints:
404  @n - none
405 
406  @note output constraints:
407  @n - cv_image should not be empty
408  @n - cv_image should be sized 640 x 480
409  @n - cv_image should be color image (3 channel)
410 
411  @return cv_image converted to opencv format image
412  """
413  try:
414  cv_image = self.bridge.imgmsg_to_cv2(data, "bgr8")
415  if cv_image is None:
416  raise NoImageError
417 
418  h, w, c = cv_image.shape
419  if((h != 480) or (w != 640)):
420  raise InputImageSizeError(w, h)
421 
422  if (c != 3):
423  raise ColorImageError(c)
424 
425  cv_image = cv2.flip(cv_image,-1)
426  return cv_image
427  except Exception as e:
428  print(e)
429  return None
430 
431  def get_draft_roi(self, img):
432  """!
433  @brief to avoid complexity of image processing, we get only draft roi.
434  @details
435 
436  @param[in] img: opencv format image
437 
438  @note input constraints:
439  @n - image should not be empty
440  @n - image should be sized 640 x 480
441  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
442 
443  @note output constraints:
444  @n - draft_roi_image should not be empty
445  @n - draft_roi_image should be color image (3 channel)
446 
447  @return draft_roi_img: roi image which is given size manually, this approach sould be modificated in future
448  """
449  try:
450  # input error check
451  if img is None:
452  raise NoImageError
453  h, w, c = img.shape
454  if((h != 480) or (w != 640)):
455  raise InputImageSizeError(w, h)
456  if (c != 3):
457  raise ColorImageError(c)
458 
459  # doing
460  draft_roi_img = img[int(h*(0/20)):int(h*(16/20)), int(w*(6/20)):int(w*(13/20))]
461 
462  # output error check
463  if draft_roi_img is None:
464  raise NoImageError
465  h, w, c = draft_roi_img.shape
466  if (c != 3):
467  raise ColorImageError(c)
468 
469  # return
470  return draft_roi_img
471 
472  except Exception as e:
473  print(e)
474  return None
475  pass
476 
477  def get_hsv(self, img):
478  """!
479  @brief for detecting marker, we pre-process image to hsv.
480  @details the function return h, s, v image. for detecting marker, we're gonna use h image cause color of marker is yellow and it's opposite of micropipette body color(body color is indigo)
481 
482  @param[in] img: draft_roi_img should be input
483 
484  @note input constraints:
485  @n - image should not be empty
486  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
487 
488  @note output constraints:
489  @n - h_image should not be empty
490  @n - h_image should be mono image (1 channel)
491  @n - s_image should not be empty
492  @n - s_image should be mono image (1 channel)
493  @n - v_image should not be empty
494  @n - v_image should be mono image (1 channel)
495 
496  @return h_img, s_img, v_img: all images sould be return
497  """
498  try:
499  # input error check
500  if img is None:
501  raise NoImageError
502  h, w, c = img.shape
503  if (c != 3):
504  raise ColorImageError(c)
505 
506  # doing
507  hsv = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2HSV)
508  h_img, s_img, v_img = cv2.split(hsv)
509 
510  # output error check
511  if (h_img is None) or (s_img is None) or (v_img is None):
512  raise NoImageError
513  if (h_img.dtype != 'uint8') or (s_img.dtype != 'uint8') or (v_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
514  raise MonoImageError(h_img.dtype)
515 
516  # return
517  return hsv, h_img, s_img, v_img
518 
519  except Exception as e:
520  print(e)
521  return None, None, None
522  pass
523 
524  def get_binary(self, img, thr, use_inv = True):
525  """!
526  @brief before getting contour from image, we should convert gray image to binary image
527  @details it is important to use apropriate image format(h or s or v), and set apropriate threshold value.
528 
529  @param[in] img: h or s or v image
530 
531  @note input constraints:
532  @n - image should not be empty
533  @n - image should be gray image (1 channel)
534 
535  @note output constraints:
536  @n - binary_image should not be empty
537  @n - binary_image should be binary image (1 channel)
538 
539  @return bin_img: output binary image
540  """
541  try:
542  if(len(img.shape)==3):
543  img = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
544  # input error check
545  if img is None:
546  raise NoImageError
547  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
548  raise MonoImageError(c)
549 
550  # doing
551  #blur = cv2.GaussianBlur(img,(11,11),0)
552  bin_img = None
553  if(use_inv):
554  ret, bin_img = cv2.threshold(img, thr, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY_INV)
555  else:
556  ret, bin_img = cv2.threshold(img, thr, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY)
557  #ret, bin_img = cv2.threshold(img, 0, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY_INV+cv2.THRESH_OTSU)
558 
559  cv2.imshow("bin_img", bin_img)
560  #cv2.waitKey()
561 
562  # output error check
563  if (bin_img is None):
564  raise NoImageError
565  if (bin_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
566  raise MonoImageError(bin_img.dtype)
567 
568  # return
569  return bin_img
570 
571  except Exception as e:
572  print(e)
573  return None
574  pass
575 
576  def remove_noise(self, img, area_min, area_max, w_min, w_max, h_min, h_max, use_morph = True):
577  """!
578  @brief remove unnessary contour, so we prevent error and focus on important data
579  @details this method reffered from "https://pyimagesearch.com/2015/02/09/removing-contours-image-using-python-opencv/"
580 
581  @param[in] img: binary image
582 
583  @note input constraints:
584  @n - image should not be empty
585  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
586 
587  @note output constraints:
588  @n - noise_removed_binary_image should not be empty
589  @n - noise_removed_binary_image should be binary image (1 channel)
590 
591  @return noise_removed_bin_img: output binary image which the noise is removed
592  """
593  try:
594  # input error check
595  if img is None:
596  raise NoImageError
597  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
598  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
599 
600  # doing
601  # Removing noise
602  # https://pyimagesearch.com/2015/02/09/removing-contours-image-using-python-opencv/
603 
604  cnts = cv2.findContours(img,cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
605  cnts = imutils.grab_contours(cnts)
606  mask = np.ones(img.shape[:2], dtype="uint8") * 255
607 
608  # loop over the contours
609  for c in cnts:
610  [x,y,w,h] = cv2.boundingRect(c)
611  # if the contour is bad, draw it on the mask
612  if cv2.contourArea(c)<area_min or cv2.contourArea(c)>area_max \
613  or h<h_min or h>h_max or w<w_min or w>w_max:
614  cv2.drawContours(mask, [c], -1, 0, -1)
615  # else:
616  # print(cv2.contourArea(c))
617  # print(w)
618  # print(h)
619 
620  # remove the contours from the image and show the resulting images
621  noise_removed_bin_img = cv2.bitwise_and(img, img, mask=mask)
622 
623  if(use_morph):
624  # somtimes, bad noise make the marker uncertain. to prevent that issue we adapt morphology method to it.
625  kernel = np.ones((15, 15), np.uint8)
626  noise_removed_bin_img = cv2.morphologyEx(noise_removed_bin_img, cv2.MORPH_OPEN, kernel)
627 
628  # output error check
629  if (noise_removed_bin_img is None):
630  raise NoImageError
631  if (noise_removed_bin_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
632  raise MonoImageError(noise_removed_bin_img.dtype)
633 
634  # return
635  return noise_removed_bin_img, mask
636 
637  except Exception as e:
638  print(e)
639  return None
640  pass
641 
642  def detect_marker(self, img):
643  """!
644  @brief detect marker and return the points of marker.
645  @details
646 
647  @param[in] img: binary image which is drawn the marker area as white
648 
649  @note input constraints:
650  @n - image should not be empty
651  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
652 
653  @note output constraints:
654  @n - cnts_img should not be empty
655  @n - cnts_img should be color image (3 channel)
656  @n - number of cnts should be 4
657 
658  @return makered_img: output marker image which is drawn contour and moment.
659  @return cnts: contour which is detected from binary image. the number of contour should be 4.
660  """
661  try:
662  # input error check
663  if img is None:
664  raise NoImageError
665  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
666  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
667 
668  # doing
669  marked_img = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_GRAY2BGR)
670 
671  pts = np.zeros((4, 2), dtype=np.float32)
672  cnts, hierarchy = cv2.findContours(img,cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
673  if(len(cnts) == 4):
674  for i in range(len(cnts)):
675  M = cv2.moments(cnts[i])
676  cX = int(M['m10'] / M['m00'])
677  cY = int(M['m01'] / M['m00'])
678 
679  cv2.circle(marked_img, (cX, cY), 3, (255, 0, 0), -1)
680  cv2.drawContours(marked_img, [cnts[i]], 0, (0, 0, 255), 2)
681 
682  pts[i] = [cX, cY]
683 
684  # output error check
685  if (marked_img is None):
686  raise NoImageError
687  if (marked_img.shape[2] != 3):
688  raise ColorImageError(marked_img.shape[2])
689  if (len(pts) != 4):
690  raise MarkerNumberError(len(pts))
691 
692  # return
693  return marked_img, pts
694 
695  except Exception as e:
696  print(e)
697  return None, None
698  pass
699 
700  def perspective_transform(self, img, pts):
701  """!
702  @brief based on detected marker, conduct perspective transform
703  @details it's refered from "https://minimin2.tistory.com/135"
704 
705  @param[in] img: draft roi image. it should be color image.
706  @param[in] pts: points of markers. the number of points should be 4.
707 
708  @note input constraints:
709  @n - image should not be empty
710  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
711  @n - the number of points should be 4
712 
713  @note output constraints:
714  @n - trans_img should not be empty
715  @n - trans_img should be color image (3 channel)
716 
717  @return trans_img: output perspective transform image.
718  """
719  try:
720  # input error check
721  if img is None:
722  raise NoImageError
723  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
724  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
725  if (len(pts) != 4):
726  raise MarkerNumberError(len(pts))
727 
728  # doing
729  sm = pts.sum(axis=1)
730  #print(sm)
731  diff = np.diff(pts, axis=1)
732 
733  topLeft = pts[np.argmin(sm)] # x+y가 가장 값이 좌상단 좌표
734  bottomRight = pts[np.argmax(sm)] # x+y가 가장 큰 값이 우하단 좌표
735  topRight = pts[np.argmin(diff)] # x-y가 가장 작은 것이 우상단 좌표
736  bottomLeft = pts[np.argmax(diff)] # x-y가 가장 큰 값이 좌하단 좌표
737 
738  # 변환 전 4개 좌표
739  pts1 = np.float32([topLeft, topRight, bottomRight, bottomLeft])
740 
741  # 변환 후 영상에 사용할 서류의 폭과 높이 계산
742  w1 = abs(bottomRight[0] - bottomLeft[0])
743  w2 = abs(topRight[0] - topLeft[0])
744  h1 = abs(topRight[1] - bottomRight[1])
745  h2 = abs(topLeft[1] - bottomLeft[1])
746  width = max([w1, w2]) # 두 좌우 거리간의 최대값이 서류의 폭
747  height = max([h1, h2]) # 두 상하 거리간의 최대값이 서류의 높이
748 
749  # 변환 후 4개 좌표
750  pts2 = np.float32([[0, 0], [width - 1, 0],
751  [width - 1, height - 1], [0, height - 1]])
752 
753  # 변환 행렬 계산
754  mtrx = cv2.getPerspectiveTransform(pts1, pts2)
755 
756  # 원근 변환 적용
757  trans_img = cv2.warpPerspective(img, mtrx, (width, height))
758 
759  # output error check
760  if (trans_img is None):
761  raise NoImageError
762  if (trans_img.shape[2] != 3):
763  raise ColorImageError(trans_img.shape[2])
764 
765  # return
766  return trans_img
767 
768  except Exception as e:
769  print(e)
770  return None
771  pass
772 
773  def get_range(self, img, min1, min2, min3, max1, max2, max3):
774  """!
775  @brief for rgb or hsv image we could adapt inrange function in opencv
776  @details
777 
778  @param[in] img: input image. it should be color image.
779  @param[in] min1: the first min parameter.
780  @param[in] min2: the second min parameter.
781  @param[in] min3: the thirds min parameter.
782  @param[in] max1: the first max parameter.
783  @param[in] max2: the second max parameter.
784  @param[in] max3: the thirds max parameter.
785 
786  @note input constraints:
787  @n - image should not be empty
788  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
789  @n - all min~max values should be ranged in 0~255
790 
791  @note output constraints:
792  @n - ranged_img should not be empty
793  @n - ranged_img should be binary image (1 channel)
794 
795  @return ranged_img: output ranged image.
796  """
797  try:
798  # input error check
799  if img is None:
800  raise NoImageError
801  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
802  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
803  if (min1 < 0 or min1 > 255):
804  raise RangeError(min1)
805  if (min2 < 0 or min2 > 255):
806  raise RangeError(min2)
807  if (min3 < 0 or min3 > 255):
808  raise RangeError(min3)
809  if (max1 < 0 or max1 > 255):
810  raise RangeError(max1)
811  if (max2 < 0 or max2 > 255):
812  raise RangeError(max2)
813  if (max3 < 0 or max3 > 255):
814  raise RangeError(max3)
815  if (min1 > max1):
816  raise MinMaxError(min1, max1)
817  if (min2 > max2):
818  raise MinMaxError(min2, max2)
819  if (min3 > max3):
820  raise MinMaxError(min3, max3)
821 
822  # doing
823  ranged_img = cv2.inRange(img, (min1, min2, min3), (max1, max2, max3))
824 
825  # output error check
826  if (ranged_img is None):
827  raise NoImageError
828  if (ranged_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
829  raise MonoImageError(ranged_img.dtype)
830 
831  # return
832  return ranged_img
833 
834  except Exception as e:
835  print(e)
836  return None
837  pass
838 
839  def get_each_roi(self, img):
840  """!
841  @brief based on perspective transform image, we get each digit of volume indicator image in vaild roi
842  @details
843 
844  @param[in] img: perspective transform image. it should be color image
845 
846  @note input constraints:
847  @n - image should not be empty
848  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
849 
850  @note output constraints:
851  @n - roi_1 should not be empty
852  @n - roi_1 should be color image (3 channel)
853  @n - roi_2 should not be empty
854  @n - roi_2 should be color image (3 channel)
855  @n - roi_3 should not be empty
856  @n - roi_3 should be color image (3 channel)
857 
858  @return roi_1: first digit image
859  @return roi_2: second digit image
860  @return roi_3: third digit image
861  """
862  # input error check
863  if img is None:
864  raise NoImageError
865  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
866  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
867 
868  # doing
869  pts_each = [[],[],[]]
870 
871  x=45; y=65; w=40; h=40
872  roi_1 = img[y:y+h, x:x+w]
873 
874  pts_each[0].append(x)
875  pts_each[0].append(y)
876 
877  x=45; y=125; w=40; h=40
878  roi_2 = img[y:y+h, x:x+w]
879 
880  pts_each[1].append(x)
881  pts_each[1].append(y)
882 
883  x=45; y=185; w=40; h=40
884  roi_3 = img[y:y+h, x:x+w]
885 
886  pts_each[2].append(x)
887  pts_each[2].append(y)
888 
889  # output error check
890  try:
891  if (roi_1 is None) or (roi_2 is None) or (roi_3 is None):
892  raise NoImageError
893  if (roi_1.shape[2] != 3) or (roi_1.shape[2] != 3) or (roi_1.shape[2] != 3):
894  raise ColorImageError(roi_1.shape[2])
895  if ((bool(pts_each[0]) == False) or (bool(pts_each[1]) == False) or (bool(pts_each[2]) == False)):
896  raise EmptyListError()
897 
898  # return
899  return roi_1, roi_2, roi_3, pts_each
900  except Exception as e:
901  print(e)
902  return None, None, None, None
903  pass
904 
905  def remove_shadow(self, img):
906  """!
907  @brief when we detec digit of volume indicator, there are too many shadow noise that we don't need. so we remove shadow.
908  @details
909 
910  @param[in] img: input image. it should be color image.
911 
912  @note input constraints:
913  @n - image should not be empty
914  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
915 
916  @note output constraints:
917  @n - shadow_removed_img should not be empty
918  @n - shadow_removed_img should be color image (3 channel)
919 
920  @return shadow_removed_img: output shadow removed image.
921  """
922  try:
923  # input error check
924  if img is None:
925  raise NoImageError
926  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
927  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
928 
929  # doing
930  rgb_planes = cv2.split(img)
931  result_norm_planes = []
932 
933  for plane in rgb_planes:
934  dilated_img = cv2.dilate(plane, np.ones((7,7), np.uint8))
935  bg_img = cv2.medianBlur(dilated_img, 21)
936  diff_img = 255 - cv2.absdiff(plane, bg_img)
937  norm_img = cv2.normalize(diff_img,None, alpha=0, beta=255, norm_type=cv2.NORM_MINMAX, dtype=cv2.CV_8UC1)
938  result_norm_planes.append(norm_img)
939 
940  shadow_removed_img = cv2.merge(result_norm_planes)
941 
942 
943 
944  # output error check
945  if (shadow_removed_img is None):
946  raise NoImageError
947  if (shadow_removed_img.shape[2] != 3):
948  raise ColorImageError(shadow_removed_img.shape[2])
949 
950  # return
951  return shadow_removed_img
952 
953  except Exception as e:
954  print(e)
955  return None
956  pass
957 
958  def get_sharpening(self, img):
959  """!
960  @brief process sharpening for detecting digit more accurately
961  @details
962 
963  @param[in] img: input image. it should be color image.
964 
965  @note input constraints:
966  @n - image should not be empty
967  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
968 
969  @note output constraints:
970  @n - sharp_img should not be empty
971  @n - sharp_img should be color image (3 channel)
972 
973  @return sharp_img: output sharpening image.
974  """
975  try:
976  # input error check
977  if img is None:
978  raise NoImageError
979  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
980  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
981 
982  # doing
983  sharpening_mask = np.array([[-1, -1, -1], [-1, 9, -1], [-1, -1, -1]])
984  sharp_img = cv2.filter2D(img, -1, sharpening_mask)
985 
986 
987 
988  # output error check
989  if (sharp_img is None):
990  raise NoImageError
991  if (sharp_img.shape[2] != 3):
992  raise ColorImageError(sharp_img.shape[2])
993 
994  # return
995  return sharp_img
996 
997  except Exception as e:
998  print(e)
999  return None
1000  pass

1002 
1003 
1004  def remove_background(self, img):
1005  """!
1006  @brief remove background and leave only digit of micropipette volume indicator
1007  @details
1008 
1009  @param[in] img: input image. it should be color image.
1010 
1011  @note input constraints:
1012  @n - image should not be empty
1013  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
1014 
1015  @note output constraints:
1016  @n - background_removed_img should not be empty
1017  @n - background_removed_img should be color image (3 channel)
1018 
1019  @return background_removed_img: output background removed image.
1020  """
1021  try:
1022  # input error check
1023  if img is None:
1024  raise NoImageError
1025  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
1026  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
1027 
1028  # doing
1029  bg_removed_img = img.copy()
1030 
1031  h, w, c = img.shape
1032  seed = (1, 1)
1033 
1034  # Use floodFill for filling the background with black color
1035  cv2.floodFill(bg_removed_img, None, seedPoint=seed, newVal=(255, 255, 255), loDiff=(20, 20, 20, 20), upDiff=(100, 100, 100, 100))
1036 
1037  # output error check
1038  if (bg_removed_img is None):
1039  raise NoImageError
1040  if (bg_removed_img.shape[2] != 3):
1041  raise ColorImageError(bg_removed_img.shape[2])
1042 
1043  # return
1044  return bg_removed_img
1045 
1046  except Exception as e:
1047  print(e)
1048  return None
1049  pass
1050 
1051  def get_small_image(self, img):
1052  """!
1053  @brief we use small image(10x10) to adapt to pre-trained model. so we convert image in here.
1054  @details
1055 
1056  @param[in] img: binary input image.
1057 
1058  @note input constraints:
1059  @n - image should not be empty
1060  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
1061 
1062  @note output constraints:
1063  @n - small_img should not be empty
1064  @n - size of small_img should be 10x10
1065  @n - smal_img should be gray image (1 channel)
1066 
1067  @return : output small size image.
1068  """
1069  try:
1070  # input error check
1071  if img is None:
1072  raise NoImageError
1073  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1074  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
1075 
1076  # doing
1077  # cv2.imshow("input_img", img)
1078  img_h, img_w = img.shape
1079  contours,hierarchy = cv2.findContours(img,cv2.RETR_EXTERNAL,cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)
1080 
1081  #print(len(contours))
1082  small_img = None
1083  bounding_rect = []
1084  if(len(contours) == 1):
1085  cnt = contours[0]
1086  [x,y,w,h] = cv2.boundingRect(cnt)
1087  bounding_rect = [x,y,w,h]
1088  M = cv2.moments(cnt, False)
1089  cx = int(M['m10'] / M['m00'])
1090  cy = int(M['m01'] / M['m00'])
1091  print(x, y, w, h)
1092 
1093  print(cx)
1094  print(int(img_w*(1/4)))
1095  if((cx < int(img_w*(1/4))) or (cx > int(img_w*(3/4)))):
1096  raise CenterError(cx, cy)
1097 
1098  if(w >= h):
1099  h = w
1100  roi_bin = img[cy-int(h/2):cy+int(h/2),x:x+w]
1101  else:
1102  w = h
1103  #print(cx-int(w/2))
1104  x_start = cx-int(w/2)
1105  if(x_start < 0):
1106  x_start = 0
1107  roi_bin = img[y:y+h,x_start:cx+int(w/2)]
1108 
1109  #print(roi_bin.shape)
1110  if((roi_bin.shape[0] == 0) or roi_bin.shape[1] == 0):
1111  raise ResizeError(roi_bin.shape[0], roi_bin.shape[1])
1112  small_img = cv2.resize(roi_bin,(10,10))
1113 
1114  # output error check
1115  if (len(contours) != 1):
1116  raise ContourError(len(contours))
1117  if (small_img is None):
1118  raise NoImageError
1119  h, w = small_img.shape
1120  if ((h != 10) or (w != 10)):
1121  raise SmallImageSizeError(w, h)
1122  if (small_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1123  raise MonoImageError(small_img.dtype)
1124 
1125  # return
1126  return small_img, bounding_rect
1127 
1128  except Exception as e:
1129  print(e)
1130  return None, None
1131  pass
1132 
1133  def detect_volume(self, img):
1134  """!
1135  @brief finally, we detect number using pre-train model
1136  @details
1137 
1138  @param[in] img: binary input image.
1139 
1140  @note input constraints:
1141  @n - image should not be empty
1142  @n - image size should be 10x10
1143  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
1144 
1145  @note output constraints:
1146  @n - image should not be empty
1147  @n - image size should be 10x10
1148  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
1149 
1150  @return vol: output detected volume.
1151  """
1152  try:
1153  # input error check
1154  if img is None:
1155  raise NoImageError
1156  h, w = img.shape
1157  if ((h != 10) or (w != 10)):
1158  raise SmallImageSizeError(w, h)
1159  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1160  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
1161 
1162  # doing
1163  roismall = img.reshape((1,100))
1164  roismall = np.float32(roismall)
1165 
1166  retval, results, neigh_resp, dists = self.model.findNearest(roismall, k = 3)
1167 
1168  if (dists[0][0] > 500000):
1169  raise KnnDistError(retval, dists[0][0])
1170 
1171  # debug_string = "retval: " + str(retval) + " / results: " + str(results) + " / neigh_resp: " + str(neigh_resp) + " / dists: " + str(dists)
1172  # print(debug_string)
1173 
1174  vol = int(retval)
1175 
1176  # output error check
1177  if(vol < 0 or vol > 9):
1178  raise EachVolumeError(vol)
1179 
1180  # return
1181  return vol
1182 
1183  except Exception as e:
1184  print(e)
1185  return -1
1186  pass
1187 
1188  def get_valid_volume(self, rt_vol, max_param = 5):
1189  """!
1190  @brief we calculate valid volume with max function.
1191  @details the method is simple. we append real-time volume to list and if the list is bigger than max_param then it will get max volume.
1192 
1193  @param[in] rt_vol: real-time volume
1194  @param[in] vol_list: volume list, it is member variable
1195  @param[in] max_param: it would decide the volumes of list is valid
1196 
1197  @note input constraints:
1198  @n - rt_vol should be ranged 0~100
1199  @n - vol_list should not be over max_param
1200 
1201  @note output constraints:
1202  @n - valid_vol should be ranged 0~100
1203 
1204  @return valid_vol: valid volume
1205  """
1206  try:
1207  # input error check
1208  if rt_vol < 0 or rt_vol > 100:
1209  raise VolumeError(rt_vol)
1210  if (len(self.vol_list) > max_param):
1211  raise VolumeListError(len(self.vol_list), max_param)
1212 
1213  # doing
1214  self.vol_list.append(rt_vol)
1215  if(len(self.vol_list) > max_param):
1216  self.vol_list.pop(0)
1217  valid_vol = max(self.vol_list)
1218  else:
1219  raise NotEnoughVolumeListError(len(self.vol_list), max_param)
1220 
1221  # output error check
1222  if valid_vol < 0 or valid_vol > 100:
1223  raise VolumeError(valid_vol)
1224 
1225  # return
1226  return valid_vol
1227 
1228  except Exception as e:
1229  print(e)
1230  return None
1231  pass
1232 
1233  def create_text_data(self):
1234  """!
1235  @brief create text data
1236  @details
1237 
1238  @param[in] img: binary input image.
1239 
1240  @note input constraints:
1241  @n - image should not be empty
1242  @n - image size should be 40x40 (size of dataset)
1243  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
1244  """
1245  try:
1246 
1247  num_dir = 0
1248  samples = np.empty((0,100))
1249  responses = []
1250  while num_dir < 10:
1251  num = 0
1252  while num < 1000:
1253  name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/'+ str(num_dir) + '/' + str(num) + '.jpg'
1254  img = cv2.imread(name, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
1255  # cv2.imshow("img",img)
1256  # cv2.waitKey(100)
1257 
1258  # input error check
1259  if img is None:
1260  raise NoImageError
1261  h, w = img.shape
1262  if ((h != 10) or (w != 10)):
1263  raise SmallImageSizeError(w, h)
1264  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1265  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
1266 
1267  # doing
1268  responses.append(int(num_dir))
1269  sample = img.reshape((1,100))
1270  samples = np.append(samples,sample,0)
1271 
1272  num = num+1
1273  string = "process: " + str(num)
1274  print(string)
1275  num_dir = num_dir+1
1276  responses = np.array(responses,np.float32)
1277  responses = responses.reshape((responses.size,1))
1278 
1279  print("create text data complete")
1280 
1281  np.savetxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalsamples.data',samples)
1282  np.savetxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalresponses.data',responses)
1283 
1284  except Exception as e:
1285  print(e)
1286  pass
1287 
1288  def ocr_train(self):
1289  """!
1290  @brief train
1291  @details
1292 
1293  @param[in] img: binary input image.
1294 
1295  @note input constraints:
1296  @n - image should not be empty
1297  @n - image size should be 40x40 (size of dataset)
1298  @n - image should be binary image (1 channel)
1299  """
1300  try:
1301 
1302  samples = np.loadtxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalsamples.data',np.float32)
1303  responses = np.loadtxt('/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/generalresponses.data',np.float32)
1304  responses = responses.reshape((responses.size,1))
1305 
1306  model = cv2.ml.KNearest_create()
1307  model.train(samples,cv2.ml.ROW_SAMPLE,responses)
1308  save_dir = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/model/knn_trained_model.xml'
1309  model.save(save_dir)
1310 
1311  acc_cnt = 0
1312  num_dir = 0
1313  while num_dir < 10:
1314  num = 0
1315  while num < 1000:
1316  name = '/root/catkin_ws/src/ocr/dataset/'+ str(num_dir) + '/' + str(num) + '.jpg'
1317  img = cv2.imread(name, cv2.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE)
1318 
1319  # input error check
1320  if img is None:
1321  raise NoImageError
1322  h, w = img.shape
1323  if ((h != 10) or (w != 10)):
1324  raise SmallImageSizeError(w, h)
1325  if (img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1326  raise MonoImageError(img.dtype)
1327 
1328  # doing
1329  roismall = img.reshape((1,100))
1330  roismall = np.float32(roismall)
1331 
1332  retval, results, neigh_resp, dists = model.findNearest(roismall, k = 1)
1333 
1334  string = "process: " + str(num_dir) + " / " + str(num) + " is " + str(retval)
1335  print(string)
1336  if(num_dir == retval):
1337  acc_cnt = acc_cnt + 1
1338 
1339  num = num + 1
1340  num_dir = num_dir + 1
1341 
1342  accuracy = acc_cnt / 10000
1343  string = "accuracy: " + str(accuracy)
1344  print(string)
1345 
1346  except Exception as e:
1347  print(e)
1348  pass
1349 
1350  def get_morpholgy_close(self, img):
1351  """!
1352  @brief to eleminate noise of image, we adapt morpholgy(Close)
1353  @details
1354 
1355  @param[in] img: input image.
1356 
1357  @note input constraints:
1358  @n - image should not be empty
1359  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
1360 
1361  @note output constraints:
1362  @n - morph_img should not be empty
1363  @n - morph_img should be gray image (1 channel)
1364 
1365  @return morph_img: output morphology image.
1366  """
1367  try:
1368  # input error check
1369  if img is None:
1370  raise NoImageError
1371  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
1372  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
1373 
1374  # doing
1375  gray = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
1376  kernel = np.ones((3, 3), np.uint8)
1377  morph_img = cv2.morphologyEx(gray, cv2.MORPH_CLOSE, kernel)
1378 
1379  # output error check
1380  if (morph_img is None):
1381  raise NoImageError
1382  if (morph_img.dtype != 'uint8'):
1383  raise MonoImageError(morph_img.dtype)
1384 
1385  # return
1386  return morph_img
1387 
1388  except Exception as e:
1389  print(e)
1390  return None
1391  pass
1392 
1393  def get_semantic_image(self, img, each_roi_pts, bounding_rect_list, rt_vol_list, valid_vol):
1394  """!
1395  @brief draw semantic image for debugging.
1396  @details it has marker roi image which which has bounding rectangle for each digit of volume indicator.
1397  @n there are also information like real-time volum / valid volume
1398  @n real-time volume is estimated volume at every time. even though all the digits are not detected successfully.
1399  @n valid volume is calculated real-time value. when the digits are detected successfully, we append this volume to list. and
1400 
1401  @param[in] img: input image. it should be roi image maden with marker
1402 
1403  @note input constraints:
1404  @n - image should not be empty
1405  @n - image should be color image (3 channel)
1406 
1407  @note output constraints:
1408  @n - semantic_img should not be empty
1409  @n - semantic_img should be color image (3 channel)
1410 
1411  @return semantic_img: output semantic image.
1412  """
1413  try:
1414  # input error check
1415  if img is None:
1416  raise NoImageError
1417  if (img.shape[2] != 3):
1418  raise ColorImageError(img.shape[2])
1419 
1420  # doing
1421  semantic_img = img.copy()
1422 
1423  black_img = np.zeros([semantic_img.shape[0],250,3],dtype=np.uint8)
1424  semantic_img = np.concatenate((semantic_img, black_img), axis=1)
1425  if(bounding_rect_list[0] != None):
1426  roi_x_1 = int(each_roi_pts[0][0])
1427  roi_y_1 = int(each_roi_pts[0][1])
1428  bounding_rect_x_1 = bounding_rect_list[0][0]
1429  bounding_rect_y_1 = bounding_rect_list[0][1]
1430  bounding_rect_w_1 = bounding_rect_list[0][2]
1431  bounding_rect_h_1 = bounding_rect_list[0][3]
1432  cv2.rectangle(semantic_img,(roi_x_1+bounding_rect_x_1,roi_y_1+bounding_rect_y_1),(roi_x_1+bounding_rect_x_1+bounding_rect_w_1,roi_y_1+bounding_rect_y_1+bounding_rect_h_1),(0,255,0),2)
1433 
1434  if(bounding_rect_list[1] != None):
1435  roi_x_2 = int(each_roi_pts[1][0])
1436  roi_y_2 = int(each_roi_pts[1][1])
1437  bounding_rect_x_2 = bounding_rect_list[1][0]
1438  bounding_rect_y_2 = bounding_rect_list[1][1]
1439  bounding_rect_w_2 = bounding_rect_list[1][2]
1440  bounding_rect_h_2 = bounding_rect_list[1][3]
1441  cv2.rectangle(semantic_img,(roi_x_2+bounding_rect_x_2,roi_y_2+bounding_rect_y_2),(roi_x_2+bounding_rect_x_2+bounding_rect_w_2,roi_y_2+bounding_rect_y_2+bounding_rect_h_2),(0,255,0),2)
1442 
1443 
1444  roi_x_3 = int(each_roi_pts[2][0])
1445  roi_y_3 = int(each_roi_pts[2][1])
1446  cv2.rectangle(semantic_img,(roi_x_3,roi_y_3),(roi_x_3+40,roi_y_3+40),(255,255,0),2)
1447  cv2.line(semantic_img,(roi_x_3+20,roi_y_3),(roi_x_3+20,roi_y_3+40),(0,0,255),2)
1448  if(bounding_rect_list[2] != None):
1449 
1450  bounding_rect_x_3 = bounding_rect_list[2][0]
1451  bounding_rect_y_3 = bounding_rect_list[2][1]
1452  bounding_rect_w_3 = bounding_rect_list[2][2]
1453  bounding_rect_h_3 = bounding_rect_list[2][3]
1454  cv2.rectangle(semantic_img,(roi_x_3+bounding_rect_x_3,roi_y_3+bounding_rect_y_3),(roi_x_3+bounding_rect_x_3+bounding_rect_w_3,roi_y_3+bounding_rect_y_3+bounding_rect_h_3),(0,255,0),2)
1455  # drawing center line
1456  cx_3 = roi_x_3+bounding_rect_x_3+int(bounding_rect_w_3/2)
1457  cy_3_top = roi_y_3+bounding_rect_y_3
1458  cy_3_bottom = roi_y_3+bounding_rect_y_3+bounding_rect_h_3
1459  cv2.line(semantic_img,(cx_3,cy_3_top),(cx_3,cy_3_bottom),(0,128,255),2)
1460 
1461  self.center_percentage = int(((cx_3 - (roi_x_3+20))/20)*100)
1462 
1463  str_valid_vol = str(valid_vol).zfill(3)
1464  str_valid_vol = "valid volume: " + str_valid_vol
1465 
1466  str_rt_vol = rt_vol_list[0]
1467  str_rt_vol = str_rt_vol + rt_vol_list[1]
1468  str_rt_vol = str_rt_vol + rt_vol_list[2]
1469  str_rt_vol = "real-time value: " + str_rt_vol
1470 
1471  str_center_percentage = str(self.center_percentage)
1472  str_center_percentage = "center percentage: " + str_center_percentage + "%"
1473 
1474  cv2.putText(semantic_img,str_valid_vol,(130, 20),0,0.5,(255,255,255),1)
1475  cv2.putText(semantic_img,str_rt_vol,(130, 70),0,0.5,(255,255,255),1)
1476  cv2.putText(semantic_img,str_center_percentage,(130, 120),0,0.5,(255,255,255),1)
1477 
1478  # output error check
1479  if (semantic_img is None):
1480  raise NoImageError
1481  if (semantic_img.shape[2] != 3):
1482  raise ColorImageError(semantic_img.shape[2])
1483 
1484  # return
1485  return semantic_img, self.center_percentage
1486 
1487  except Exception as e:
1488  print(e)
1489  return None, None
1490  pass
